intro: Erigeron pedatus, commonly known as the showy tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the stems are hairy and branching. Erigeron pedatus produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
